definition: sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas

sentences.english: At the 2006 Asian Games CHAN WAI-KEI won silver in the women's windsurfing competition.
sentences.chinese: 2006年亚运，陈慧琪赢得女子滑浪风帆竞赛银牌。

sentences.english: The wind and rain buffeted the sails.
The sails are not answering to our pull on the ropes.
sentences.chinese: 我们拉绳风帆不听使唤。

sentences.english: The international community stepped in to build the boat. This is global solidarity.
sentences.chinese: 维权人士拉起风帆，国际社会造就航船，全球一心。

sentences.english: Raise your sail one foot and you get ten feet of wind。
sentences.chinese: 撑起一尺的风帆，你会得到10尺的风力。

sentences.english: If I go windsurfing, I'll look like a klutz.
sentences.chinese: 如果我去风帆，我就会像一个劣势。

sentences.english: I learned to windsurf on an activity holiday.
sentences.chinese: 我参加主题活动假期时学会了风帆冲浪。

sentences.english: Fortuna escaped the destruction of the sail barge in a small private skiff.
sentences.chinese: 风帆游船被毁时，福图纳在私人小艇里逃过一劫。

sentences.english: Some people say that youth is the sea, because he was unfurling the ideal sailing ahead.
sentences.chinese: 有人说青春是海，因为他为理想扬起前进的风帆。

sentences.english: With all the sails up, the little boat swept along in the pleasant wind.
sentences.chinese: 小舟张起全部风帆在和风中轻快地前进。

sentences.english: Fabricates and repairs sails and other articles from sailcloth.
sentences.chinese: 制造和修补风帆和其它的帆布物品。

sentences.english: Only dare to set sail, top evil billow warriors, to fight to the upstream.
sentences.chinese: 只有敢于扬起风帆，顶恶浪的勇士，才能争到上游。

sentences.english: Artoo served as a waiter, distributing drinks aboard Jabba's sail barge.
sentences.chinese: R2成了服务员，在贾巴的风帆游艇上分发饮料。

sentences.english: I wish these children will keep voyaging towards their wonderful lives with sails of love.
sentences.chinese: 祝愿这些孩子们，扬起爱的风帆，在人生的路上远航。

sentences.english: The sails were hove by the strong wind.

definition: to set sail/to brave the waves
sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas
